pcricketstats

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcricketstats.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class, which is responsible for the creation of each player.
    Author:
    Rob Attfield
     

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int playerID, java.lang.String playerName, java.lang.String countryName, java.lang.String careerSpan, int matchesPlayed, int inningsPlayed, int ballsBowled, int runsConceded, int wicketsTaken, double bowlingAverage, double economyRate, double strikeRate, int fiveWicketsInnings)
      The main constructor for the Player class - which is used to create a player from each row in the CSV file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int playerID,
      java.lang.String playerName,
      java.lang.String countryName,
      java.lang.String careerSpan,
      int matchesPlayed,
      int inningsPlayed,
      int ballsBowled,
      int runsConceded,
      int wicketsTaken,
      double bowlingAverage,
      double economyRate,
      double strikeRate,
      int fiveWicketsInnings)
        The main constructor for the Player class - which is used to create a player from each row in the CSV file.
        Parameters:
        playerID - The player's ID number.
        playerName - The player's full name.
        countryName - The country which the player plays for.
        careerSpan - The years during which the player played (formatted like "1988-2006").
        matchesPlayed - The number of matches played by the player.
        inningsPlayed - The number of innings played by the player.
        ballsBowled - The number of balls bowled by the player.
        runsConceded - The amount of runs conceded by the player.
        wicketsTaken - How many wickets the player has taken.
        bowlingAverage - The player's bowling average.
        economyRate - The player's bowling economy rate.
        strikeRate - The player's bowling strike rate (runs conceded per wicket taken).
        fiveWicketsInnings - The number of innings where the player has taken 5 wickets.
